definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The actuator placement optimization of piezothermoelastic biotic thermal robust structure is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 研究了熱壓電仿生熱魯棒結構致動器放置優化的問題。

sentences.english: Make sure use the saw with continuous watering to prevent building a fire through scraping.
sentences.chinese: 使用盤鋸肯定不要斷水，防止摩擦生熱陰燃起火。

sentences.english: He was constantly rubbing his hands , which generated heat.
sentences.chinese: 他在不停地摩擦雙手而生熱。

sentences.english: The heat build-up of 10 rubber compounds in a radial tire was investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究子午線輪胎用10種膠料的生熱特性。

sentences.english: The interior heat build-up in PU solid tire was investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究聚氨酯實心輪胎的內生熱特性。

sentences.english: The result showed that tin-coupled structure contributed to low heat build-up.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明偶聯結構是其生熱低的主要原因。

definition: inner product/the dot product of two vectors
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
